text: Ansel Easton Adams (February 20, 1902 â€“ April 22, 1984) was a renowned American photographer and environmentalist, best known for his black-and-white photographs of the American West and primarily Yosemite National Park. == Works == === Notable photographs === * Monolith, The Face of Half Dome, 1927. * Rose and Driftwood, 1932. * Yosemite Valley, Clearing Winter Storm, 1937 or earlier, probably 1935 * Moonrise, Hernandez, New Mexico, 1941. * Ice on Ellery Lake, Sierra Nevada, 1941. * Winter morning, Sierra Nevada from Lone Pine, 1944 * Georgia O'Keeffe and Orville Cox at Canyon de Chelly * Aspens, New Mexico, 1958. === A few of Adams' photographs === File:Ansel Adams - Farm workers and Mt.
